In 1958, [[A. W. Phillips]{.link}](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Phillips_(economist)) (1914—1975) [empirically]{.note} found that [low]{.hi-blue} rates of unemployment were associated with [high]{.hi-red} rates of inflation, and *high* unemployment with *low* inflation.

. . .

![](phillips.png){fig-align="right" width="300" height="300"}


## Types of inflation

This relationship has since been referred to as the [[Phillips curve]{.red}]{.note}.
